intro: Bunchosia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing seeds. Bunchosia strigosa is often found in dry, disturbed areas and is adapted to arid conditions.
